Title: A class-wide phylogenetic assessment of Dothideomycetes
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Pezizomycotina, Dothideomyceta, fungal
evolution, lichens, multigene phylogeny, phylogenomics, plant pathogens,
saprobes, Tree of Life
Abstract:
We present a comprehensive phylogeny derived from 5 genes,
nucSSU, nucLSU rDNA, TEF1, RPB1 and RPB2, for 356 isolates and 41
families (six newly described in this volume) in Dothideomycetes. All
currently accepted orders in the class are represented for the first
time in addition to numerous previously unplaced lineages. Subclass
Pleosporomycetidae is expanded to include the aquatic order Jahnulales.
An ancestral reconstruction of basic nutritional modes supports numerous
transitions from saprobic life histories to plant associated and
lichenised modes and a transition from terrestrial to aquatic habitats
are confirmed. Finally, a genomic comparison of 6 dothideomycete genomes
with other fungi finds a high level of unique protein associated with
the class, supporting its delineation as a separate taxon.
